definition: to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)

sentences.english: Just to sing the autumn season Sad Song, jealously guarding one's the end of time?
sentences.chinese: 只为了吟唱一季凄婉的秋歌，独守一个人的地老天荒？

sentences.english: And softer sings the linnet from the thorn;
sentences.chinese: 荆棘丛的红雀吟唱声更加无愁。

sentences.english: As it Dongmei sang songs of early spring.
sentences.chinese: 就象那冬梅吟唱着早春的歌声。

sentences.english: The audience even crooned to the rhythm of the songs.
sentences.chinese: 台下的听众跟着歌声低声吟唱。

sentences.english: First love is singing about vernal blazing passion, performing our young maturation.
sentences.chinese: 初恋吟唱着青春炽烈的激情，上演着我们青涩的成熟。

sentences.english: To melt and be like a running book that sings its melody to the night.
sentences.chinese: 融化为一道奔流的溪水，在夜晚吟唱自己的清曲。

sentences.english: In hopes of fighting off the disease, he ordered unending prayer and parades of chanters through the streets.
sentences.chinese: 为了与病魔做斗争，教皇下令祈祷者沿街游行吟唱。

sentences.english: Can you sing with all the voices of the mountain?
sentences.chinese: 你能否籍大山的千重回响吟唱？

sentences.english: Different ways of reciting bring about variant appearances of poems.
sentences.chinese: 不同的吟唱方式便使诗作产生不同的风貌。

sentences.english: He deign'd not to belie his soul in songs.
sentences.chinese: 他未屈尊吟唱，示灵魂以假象。

sentences.english: Night wind Department, poplar leaves rustles, they are singing from the songs?
sentences.chinese: 夜风处，白杨树的叶子沙沙响，它们是在吟唱离歌吗？

sentences.english: The poetry was chanted to the accompaniment of the lyre.
sentences.chinese: 诗歌吟唱时是用七弦琴伴奏的。

sentences.english: She chanted hymns and prayers with the voice of a cantor.
sentences.chinese: 她用圣诗领唱者的嗓音吟唱赞美诗和祈祷词。

sentences.english: To melt and be like a running brook that sings its melody to the night .
sentences.chinese: 融合为一道奔流的溪水，在夜晚吟唱自己的清曲。

sentences.english: Dropping from the veils of the mourning to where the cricket sings;
sentences.chinese: 降低从早晨的幕幛，到蟋蟀吟唱的地点。

definition: to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
to read out/to recite/to remember sb (while talking about sth else)
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
